snippet: It wasn't like they were expected to be wearing Mao-era tunics and leftover get-ups from the Cultural Revolution. But a number of high-ranking delegates decided to wear high-end outfits and accessories to the annual Communist Party meetings in...
abstract: It wasn't like they were expected to be wearing Mao-era tunics and leftover get-ups from the Cultural Revolution. But a number of high-ranking delegates decided to wear high-end outfits and accessories to the annual Communist Party meetings in Beijing. And they were hardly shy about it, which drove the Sinosphere crazy.

headline.main: Communist Bling: It's All the Rage in China
